session.description: Cities are the most affected elements by open data. Open information is essential for cities, regions, countries and communities in general. Citizenship must get benefit from this data and local governments have to organize it.

tweets.content: @vmizquierdo: #IODC16 A global marketplace for city Data. Question: My city is Nairobi and the main problem is garbage. What can we do with OpenData?

conference_notes:
This panel was an interesting session where it was possible to notice relevant takeaways:
  • -We should focus on using open data to solve the most pressing public issues. There is no need to think about magical solutions for non-existent problems.
  • Bottom up is the way to address massive data and information gaps to enable evidence based planning and social development.There were also some great examples of Open Data initiatives in Los Angeles: LA GeoHub, LA High Injury Network (which led to evidence based change in planning). Crowdsourcing and citizen science toolkit (Open Acres. People mapped 22,000 open spaces in the city of LA).
name: A Global Marketplace for City Data
